title: Uhh guys... I might have figured out what Brand really is...
body:
Screw the old vague "spooky spirit posessing a human" trope. Back then in old lore that might have made sense, but right now in new lore we actually have a whole cast of body-snatching-spirit-thingies from outer space. The targonian aspects to be exact.

At first I never thought about it, because Freljord and Mt. Targon seem to be completly seperate worlds to me, but nevertheless they are connected and part of the same universe. But what exactly could Brand be an aspect of? I mean, we got the sun {{champion:89}} , the moon {{champion:131}} , the protector/life {{champion:44}}, a certain constellation {{champion:432}}  (bard is not related to targon, but as a celestial being  he still needs to posess a material body to act in thew world) and {{champion:80}} ,  and the stars/the night sky itself {{champion:136}}  (who, as a matter-manipulator, can materialize at will).

However, there is something missing. What about a falling star? Pantheon's lore mention a falling star, although he might as well be refering to Aurelion Sol in that moment.

Now imagine the following scenario: celestial body crashes down on valoran while filled with gody power. Usually it would eradicate everything in its surroundings due to the excess energy. HOWEVER, it crashed right into a giant block of true ice that basicially locks up the giant meteroite and the being it contains. 

However, it can still form a connection to a sentinent being, even when seperated in matter of space. Pretty much just how the protector "pulled" Taric onto the mountain, it draws a nameless Lokfarian to it and takes him over. But the fall and the long imprisonment in ice that is potentially void-corrupted might have caused some little mental damage (if the being was not insane already before dropping down to earth), and now it's oddly fixated around burning everything. (if that wasn't its thing before, just how pantheon's thing is war).

What exactly that fallen star once was? No clue. Maybe a Targonian that has turned on his friends and was defeated? Aurelion Sol's lore mentions that there had been "more voices" in the past that echoed through his crown. Internal conflicts of the Targonians were mentioned as well, so Brand might be a causality of that conflict. A god banished from the skys to to speak.

HOW DID I NEVER EVEN NOTICE THAT POSSIBILITY?

Fun Fact: Anivia is actually not an ice-elemental.

She is a local spirit, that is the manifestation of what is commonly known as a jungian archetype of the Freljord. She's actually an representation of the lands she is bound to. If there was a radical climate change going on and Freljord would become a forrest, she would probably stop being an ice-bird.

On the other hand, if the Freljord was to be swallowed by black ice, she would die and be reborn as Blackfrost Anivia. 

Another, more fancy description, might also be "Soul of the Land" for this type of spirit.

Sorry to disappoint you guys but Brands true lore is this:

Back in 2009 when league was just out there was a summoner: Brand 
He was a good player but very bad at team play and very toxic to his teamates. 
He flamed so much that his teams started trolling him. 

However, Brand persisted in trying to climb.

One day as he was on his way to win his promo deciding game to get into silver and finally leave bronze a fire started in his house (he had forgotten the kettle on). 

Brand refused to move from his chair and played to the best of his ability but his team trolled him hard and victory was yet out of reach.
Then as he was choking on smoke and the fire started licking his clothes his team trolled on max and died, leaving him in a 1vs5 because they were fighting in the enemy base for kills instead of finishing the enemy nexus with 100HP. 
Brand would have none of it! As his skin was melting he performed the most stunning mechanical outplay in the history of the league. Upon getting the pentakill and marching for the nexus, his team decided to troll him one last time.

Yes they did a 4-1 surrender vote. Brand was Auto attacking the nexus when he got the defeat screen.

Legend has it that he was flaming in the end game screen even as he burned to cinders. His flaming was so vulgar and deranged that Riot decided to delete any records of the game, to avoid exposing us to it, even if that game had the best pentakill in the history.

His soul was so filled with such malice that he managed to possess an unsuspecting citizen of Valoran giving him his flaming abilities so he can extract revenge on all the trolls and feeders in league....

Back when the world was young, there was a cabal of elementals. They were the first of this world along with the angels ({{champion:10}} {{champion:25}} ), the darkin ({{champion:266}} ), the first beings of magic, the djinn, and he who came before all others. ({{champion:24}} )

When the first great invasion was squelched and all other races were weakened immensely, the elementals went their separate ways to guard all portions of the world.

The leader ({{champion:34}} ) stayed in the north, the vanguard of ice and snow. 
The titan ({{champion:54}} ) returned to the mountains, silently keeping vigil from the eyes of fledgling races.
Sadly, they are the only ones who remained whole after the invasion.

The sage ({{champion:57}} ) guarded a beautiful island all alone...until a fledgling race corrupted his home and drove him to rage.
The archer ({{champion:40}} ) grew too weak to live on his own. He bound himself to one who may cleanse the filth of pollution from his domain.
The assassin ({{champion:56}} ) grew tired of the new races. He wanted peace and silence....bought with blood.
The healer (???) sank to the depths of the ocean, remaining there in silence. The others are unsure if life still flows in the waters.
Finally, most tragic of all, the warrior ({{champion:63}} ) grew restless. He yearned for war and combat, he yearned for another invasion...and he yearned for stronger foes. He turned against his brethren, only to be captured for an untold millenia.

Ice. Earth. Nature. Wind. Shadow. Water. Flame. The seven elements of runeterra, the seven sentinels who guarded this world.

Oh, ok, so we're doing that. "You're headcanon doesn't work so I hate it." Let's go through this:

First of all, Kayle and Morgana are heading for a large lore rework. So literally anything you suggest could be factual. And let's be clear: Riot's never been afraid from making massive, character changing reworks. (Remember the Freljord or was that before your time?)

Second of all, again, all of the things OP listed are headcanon as well. You can approve or deny it or say "IT HAS LIKES TO LORE" but that don't mean a damn thing. It's still headcanon. It still has just as much relevancy as anyone elses, whether you like it or not. (From the downvotes, I'd assume not).

Thirdly, all your spouting about "THEY'RE NOT FROM THIS WORLD" is pointless because Riot has already established that they're making this a cohesive, singular world.  Notice how Renekton and Nasus used to be from another world but are now Shuriman? Notice how Taric used to be a gem knight from another dimension but is now a Targon aspect? Saying "NO NO IT CANT BE THIS BECAUSE THE OLD LORE"- Old Lore is dead chap. Deal.

(Nocturne's also headed for a massive rework because his story is STILL all about summoners so hold onto that while you can.)

And why should headcanon have to have direct ties to old lore or pre-existing lore? Why should one HAVE to work with old lore? Let's get one thing straight: Old lore, just like new lore, has problems. Old lore is not some friggin' sacred golden cow that can't be touched and is a bastion of narrative excellence. Arguing an idea for lore change to better suite the world (Which it would, considering it explains things better than current lore) doesn't make it wrong.

You're dismissing headcanon because you're saying it doesn't tie to the original canon. Which is a weak argument. You should go back to the drawing board and think about what you're arguing because right now it holds even less basis than my headcanon.

A headcanon should fill the gaps in between what is said, not twist everything around and "give it a new purpose". Go write your own story if you like it, but don't force other fictional universes to bend to your liking.

Sorry but I disagree.

Let's be frank: League's strings have always been immensely weak after the lore rework. As an example: What are the strings to your own theory? Brand is a star because.....there are celestial bodies that exist and Brand could be one of them because he possessed someone. That's just as strong as my own. You're basically giving Brand an entire origin that in no way references anything about his previous characte other than "stars are fire too"r. I disagree, but I'm not going to say "Your thread is garbage" because I don't agree with it. (Which seems to be what's going on here)

And if we're being brutally honest, you're cutting out just as much from Brand. He's no longer a chaotic fire elemental, he's a celestial star. Why would a star care about setting a world on fire? Does that mean Janna is an aspect from Targon as well because a wind elemental bound to her and she's the winds of the cosmos? How much are we going to cut and slash so that we're agreeing that "it fits the universe better"? Why is it ok for you to bend the rules of a character and make him from an entirely different realm but it's not ok for me to do similar things, just with other characters that share a thematic element?

Overall, I really don't agree with head canon fitting 1:1 in the bounds of a universe. Head canon shouldn't just be about fitting puzzle pieces, it should be running with threads, seeing where they go and imagining things in new lights. Does this mean I'm passing my story/idea as law? Course not. It's just head canon. Am I completely and utterly destroying these characters to fit them to my whim? Again, of course not. Just building on what the character is. But to argue that one head canon has somehow more factual basis and relevancy than another and that one story completely changes the original character while the other "stays true to the roots" is farcical.

A headcanon doesn't have to be 1:1. However, there is a difference in crack-headcanons (like weird shipping) and serious headcanons that have a high possibility rate of being canon.

Let me copy paste something I already said in the thread:

All aspects are celestial beings. Not all celestial beings are aspects. However, they share the same properties as celestial beings. 

Yes, insects and humans are different, yet they follow the same definition of being alive: being mortal, being bound to one body while being under several limitations (not invulnerable, not invincible, no absolutes in their existence). That's how it applies to the celestial beings as well.

Targonians are relatively simple while bard is a being beyond all comprehension. However, the "celestial beings"-rules apply to all of them.
